conclusion: Parallel-plate capacitor with horizontal plates, distance between plates is d, metal plate with thickness l on the lower plate, charged particle P stationary above the metal plate, constant voltage power supply connected.
Electric field magnitude in capacitor is E = V/d.
Effective separation between plates becomes (d-l) when metal plate is inserted, electric field is E = V/(d-l).
Forces on particle P must balance since it is stationary: gravitational force F_g = mg downward, electric force F_e = qE.
Electric force equals gravitational force: qE = mg.
Assuming P has a positive charge, electric field points upward to balance gravity: qE = mg.
When metal plate is removed, distance between plates returns to d, electric field changes to E' = V/d.
Electric force on P changes when metal plate is removed.
Total force on P after plate removal is F_total = F_e' - F_g = qV/d - mg.
From initial equilibrium: qV/(d-l) = mg, therefore q = mg(d-l)/V.
Substituting q into total force equation: F_total = mg(d-l)/d - mg.
Final answer: acceleration of particle P after metal plate is removed is -g(l/d), indicating downward acceleration.
